active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the trade-offs of adopting a broad framework like NIST CSF versus a sector-specific one like HIPAA for a healthcare startup. Consider factors like cost, scalability, and regulatory alignment. Support arguments with real-world breach examples (e.g., Equifax and PCI-DSS non-compliance).
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Industry Standards Compliance (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security And Risk Management > Security Concepts and Principles > Risk Management and Governance > Compliance and Regulatory Requirements > Industry Standards Compliance). Generate 50 high-quality Anki-style flashcards optimized for spaced repetition, active recall, and Bloom's Taxonomy progression. Incorporate: - Learning Objectives: [REMEMBER: List 6 standards...; UNDERSTAND: Explain NIST/ISMS...; etc. - paste full list]. - Scaffolding Layers: [Layer1: Foundation...; Layer2: Components (NIST CSF functions, ISO 27001 ISMS, CIS Controls, PCI-DSS, HIPAA, GDPR, COBIT)...; Layer3: Implementation...; Layer4: Integration... - paste full descriptions]. - Active Learning Tie-ins: Questions inspired by discussion (framework trade-offs), peer teaching (explain components), problem-solving (scenarios). - Web Research: Core concepts (ISMS, risk mgmt), frameworks from NIST.gov, ISO.org, CISecurity.org, PCIsecuritystandards.org, HHS.gov/HIPAA, GDPR.eu. Visualize mentally: Concept map with 'Industry Standards Compliance' central, linked to frameworks and risk mgmt. Output Format (JSON array of objects, exactly 50 cards): [ { "front": "Question text", "back": "Answer | Explanation: ... | Distractors (if MCQ): A)..., B)..., C)... | Tags: [Bloom: LEVEL] [Layer: #] [Framework: NAME]", "type": "MCQ|Short Answer|Cloze|Scenario" } ] Guidelines: - Cover all frameworks evenly (at least 7-8 cards each). - 20% Layer1, 30% Layer2, 25% Layer3, 25% Layer4. - Bloom distribution: 30% lower (REM/UND), 40% mid (APP/ANA), 30% higher (EVA/CRE). - Distractors: Strictly per protocol (plausible misconceptions). - Explanations: 1-3 sentences, source-linked, pedagogical (link to objectives/layers). - Ensure clarity, accuracy, completeness (no truncations), voter consensus (pedagogy, expanded lists). - Varied formats for engagement; no duplicates.
